review_blob:
Poured from the can into a hefeweizen glass. 

Aroma - clove and banana. Slight hint of floral hops. Breast malt in the background. 

Appearance - fluffy white head. Pale straw. Hazy. 

Taste - more clove forward. Slight hint of banana and warming alcohol. Bit of a floral tartness in the back. 

Mouthfeel - dry crisp finish. Spritzy carbonation. Medium light bodied. 

Overall - a decent Bavarian Weiss beer. I tend to like them with more banana esters over the cloves. Refreshing and balanced 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Served from 16 oz can packaged on April 1st 2014

Aroma - peach, citrus, dank resiny hops. Bit of melon and sweet fruit 

Appearance - thick off white head that lingered. Hazy orange. Almost looks like a German Hefeweizen

Taste - hop forward. Mango, peach, and stone fruit. Citrusy and piney on the back end. 

Mouthfeel - rounded start and crisp dry finish. Light bodied. Punchy bitterness that lingers - borders on harsh but never really gets there. Great hop character that is intense AND drinkable. 

Overall - lives up to the hype. Fantastic double IPA that stands out among the rest. Dangerously drinkable and complex 



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a bomber into pint glass

Aroma - Floral and citrus hops. Slight caramel on the back end

Appearance - orange and hazy. Thin Off white head that lingered and laced the glass

Taste - floral and piney hops dominate. delicate malt profile on the back end, but hop forward. Firm bitterness throughout. 

Mouthfeel - medium carbonation. Medium bodied with light finish. 

Overall - nice hoppy IPA. Finishes dry and clean. very refreshing

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from bomber bottle bought at bevmo. 

Aroma - hop forward pineapple and citrus. Candy and dank pine. 

Appearance - light gold and hazy. Thick off white head. 

Flavor - zesty fruit and citrus. Nice hint of caramel malt and dark fruits balancing the hop profile. Clean yeast profile which helps the hops shine through. 

Mouthfeel - medium carbonation. Finished nice and dry. Very refreshing. 

Overall - very nice DIPA from Heretic. Great drinkable balance between the malt, hops, and alcohol. Very well made beer. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from bomber bottle bought at the brewery

Aroma - Citrus and Pine. Clean malt. Hint of caramel. 

Appearance - Crystal clear orange. Thin white head. Good retention. Great lacing on the glass. 

Taste - Very clean. Citrus and pine hops forward. Slight malt backbone. Incredibly clean. Good bitterness that never gets harsh. 

Overall - fantastic beer. Incredibly well made. Dangerously drinkable. 



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Served from a bomber bottle

Aroma - Citrus hops forward with candy and caramel malt behind

Appearance - Hazy golden with a thin white head. Plenty of lacing in the glass

Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Rounded with a medium dry finish

Taste - Light citrus hops and some slight caramel malt on the finish. Good lingering and pleasant bitterness at the end. 

Overall a nice, easy to drink IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma - resiny hops and pine. Citrus fruit. Malt

Appearance - orange-red and clear. Beige head that stayed and laced the glass. 

Taste - Malt forward with a good hop bite on the back end. Nice balance between the malt sweetness and hops

Mouthfeel - medium bodied. Medium carbonation. Very drinkable for a 9% beer

Overall - a very nice beer. Hides the 9.9% abv dangerously well. Reminds me of a happier version of their brown shugga. Another Trademark clean fermented ale from lagunitas

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma - Caramel and dark fruit up front. Malt forward - hop aromas muted Appearance - thin beige head. Deep red color Taste - medium light bodied with a crisp dry finish. Good form hop bitterness backbone supporting the malt. Lingering bitterness on the finish Overall - very well balanced beer. Refreshing and drinkable. Good hop bitterness present that I wasnt picking up in the nose ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma - Heavy on the raspberry. Not much malt or sour complexity. Slight hints of vanilla. Reminded me of raspberry frozen yogurt. 

Appearance - Deep red and translucent. Thin pink head. 

Taste - Good balance of raspberry fruitiness and lambic sourness. The balance leans toward the tart raspberry, but the lambic funk is definitely notice able. 

Mouthfeel - highly carbonated and acidic. Light-medium bodied. 

Overall - a very nice and a approachable sour beer. Highly drinkable and refreshing with some good complex notes as well. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma - Strong cherry and tart fruit with some subtle hints of vanilla and oak

Appearance - Brilliantly clear. Thin off white head. Deep burgundy color

Taste - Strong acidity and puckering sour notes dominate. Incredibly tart - getting lots of sour lemon juice 

Palate - acidic and puckering. Light-medium bodied with a Very dry finish

Overall - great sour beer. Hits the upper end of the spectrum for sourness and acidity. This one is for the true sour heads

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
